[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str()] [Path Traversal] Can crafted input strings with relative path components ('../', './') in module names or resource paths bypass access control checks and read system-reserved state keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str()] [Type Confusion] Can an attacker craft input strings that match multiple pattern branches due to overlapping prefixes, causing type confusion between 'code', 'resource', and 'resource_group' variants leading to unauthorized state access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str()] [Denial of Service] Can excessively long input strings (millions of characters) cause memory exhaustion during the split() operation, causing validator nodes to crash during transaction simulation? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str()] [Panic Condition] Does the split('::') operation handle empty strings or strings with only delimiters correctly, or can it cause index-out-of-bounds panics when accessing parts array elements? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - code branch] [Access Control Bypass] Can an attacker provide a system address (0x1, 0x2, etc.) in the 'code' branch to read privileged Move module bytecode that should only be accessible to framework accounts? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - code branch] [Module Spoofing] Does the AccountAddress::from_str() call validate that the address is properly formatted, or can malformed addresses like '0xG1' or '0x' (without enough bytes) bypass validation and create invalid StateKeys? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - code branch] [Identifier Injection] Can IdentStr::new() be exploited with special characters (null bytes, unicode, control characters) in module names to bypass Move VM identifier validation and access restricted modules? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - code branch] [Buffer Overflow] Does IdentStr::new() properly validate the length of the module name, or can extremely long names cause buffer overflows in downstream Move VM operations? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - code branch] [Reserved Name Collision] Can an attacker use reserved Move keywords or system module names to create StateKeys that collide with internal framework modules, causing state corruption? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - resource branch] [Module Address Spoofing] Can the module_address be crafted to point to an attacker-controlled account while the resource address points to a victim, bypassing resource ownership checks in Move VM? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - resource branch] [String Concatenation Injection] Does the format!() call that joins 'module_address::module_name::rest' properly escape special characters, or can injected '::' in 'rest' elements break StructTag parsing logic? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - resource branch] [Array Slice Vulnerability] Can the 'rest @ ..' slice pattern be exploited with empty arrays or single-element arrays to cause index out of bounds when constructing the StructTag string? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - resource branch] [StructTag Validation Bypass] Does StructTag::from_str() perform complete validation of type parameters and module paths, or can malformed structs like '0x1::coin::Coin<>' (empty generics) bypass validation? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - resource branch] [Error Propagation] If StateKey::resource() returns an error for invalid struct tags, is the error properly propagated or can it be silently ignored, leading to simulation proceeding with invalid state keys? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - resource_group branch] [Resource Group Confusion] Can an attacker craft input that creates a resource_group StateKey that collides with regular resource keys, bypassing resource isolation guarantees and accessing data across resource boundaries? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-transaction-simulation-session/src/state_store.rs] [Function: from_str() - resource_group branch] [Type Parameter Exploitation] Can deeply nested or malicious type parameters in resource groups cause different behavior than regular resources, potentially bypassing gas metering or access control checks?
